text:
As a member of the Regional Flood and Coastal Committee I see first hand how much good work is done by @N_landCouncil , @EnvAgencyYNE & partners. Northumberland's Floods team is small but punches above its' weight as this well deserved award recognises:-
https://t.co/XRNLzFHjJJ

@DefraGovUK @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency @ForestryComm You don’t seem to be doing very much to protect our rivers; @thameswater pumps raw sewage into the Thames and tributaries every time it rains. Run off from agribusiness has increased phosphate pollution by 40% and you’ve cut budgets for enviro protection by >60%.
@shaldonangler @gmasselink @SW_EEP @Nick_Ely @EnvAgencySW Thanks, Stuart.

text: @TraceyMaryHart @gmasselink @SW_EEP @Nick_Ely @EnvAgencySW Oh yes, and they were fine this time. What is unusual is that this point (about the most vulnerable on the entire scheme) was nearly overtopped by a relatively small tide and high pressure (hence the gates being open.) Tide didn’t get close to the defences in other areas.
@shaldonangler @gmasselink @SW_EEP @Nick_Ely @EnvAgencySW Oh dear. The flood defences have been ok up until now, haven’t they?

@DefraGovUK @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency @ForestryComm Lol, do you really think anyone believes your weasel words? If you are committed to the environment, then why are you continuing to allow rich landowners to burn peat?

RT @DefraGovUK: As hosts of #COP26, we're committed to protecting and restoring our natural environment.

We're working #TogetherForOurPlan…
